title: Why are Yasuo mains hated so much?
body:
Title is self-explanatory.

I also wanna hear out your opinions on this; be honest with it and try to control your anger if you comment in a rant as an answer to this.

As a Yasuo main myself, I'm relatively nice and easy-going to other people but there are those times where in I'm just straight-up pissed where I'm not gonna be toxic and instead be sadistic and condescending as hell and just say, "kill that bastard" in the chat when I wanna kill someone.

replies.body:
he feels unfair to play against

and also a lot of yasuo players feed their asses off.

This is probably the most accurate description I can get. One thing though is that not all Yasuo players feed. Some tend to be more lenient in their behavior and try their best to play well, even in bad match-ups and circumstances.

To be fair it is a generalization fed by confirmation bias. People hate the champion, and that just bled over to the players of that champion.

The champion has an overloaded kit, he can do a lot of things that others cannot, and there is this perception that the champion is powerful. Thus people expect the champion to perform well. Teammates of Yasuo players expect them to play well and be OP, meanwhile any new Yasuo players expect to do well because they think he's OP too.

What people don't think about is that his kit also has a higher skill floor than they expect. On top of that, his kit is probably very fun to execute (wouldn't know, I think I only ever played him once), and feels very skillful to do well with. so Yasuo players who do well often get a big head about it and taunt / spam mastery.

When things go south, everyone's expectations go down the toilet and they become upset that things are not going as they planned. Oftentimes when expectations are violated, toxicity ensues. The new Yasuo player is upset they are not actually OP, and the team hates them for doing badly when they were expected to do well. Everyone thinks, 'wtf this isn't how its supposed to work,' and begin looking for reasons to blame.

This also applies to the enemy team, if they see a Yasuo on the opposing team they expect him to be OP and prepare themselves for a frustrating game. So if things go well for the Yasuo they just think, meh it's to be expected, he's OP. Stupid champ is overloaded and should be nerfed. And if it goes poorly for the Yasuo, they feel vindicated taking out their frustration with the kit by stomping him and tilting him and his team in all chat.

It's a self-feeding hatred that the community has built up over time. People always notice when something negative happens, and rarely notice when it goes well instead. Over many many games of only noticing the negative experiences surrounding the champion and his playerbase, everyone has built up a huge confirmation bias against him.

The resulting expectation is that, 'if the enemy team has Yasuo he's going to be OP, and if we have him he's going to be a toxic scrublord and a feeder.'

The problem with having a higher skill floor, is that the skill floor isn't something which is hard to obtain on any champion. It's just a small amount of practice to reach the skill floor of any champion, if any at all. It's purely based on understanding the mechanics of the champion which, until we start drawing runes on the screen 2 ryze reworks from now, will always be rather simple. So some champions, or players, will require hands on experience to reach the skill floor and others can just be read and contemplated to reach that point.

The skill ceiling is defined by having a very nuanced and detailed understanding of the champion's kit, which allows you to make far higher risk plays and micromanage the champion in situations which seem to be impossible to have won. 

The problem is that if you give a champion such a high skill floor, that it's bordering on other champion's skill ceiling, then that implies that having a understanding of the champions mechanics is equivalent in output to having a reasonable amount of experience and intuitive feeling for a champion's exact capabilities.

Yet if they made that the only requirement of a yasuo player, then there would be no difference between a good and great yasuo player, so any champion's skill ceiling inherently must be significantly higher than their skill floor (excluding anything that riotRepertoir get his hands on), yet if their skill floor is set so relatively high, then they will have significantly more potential than the average champion. 

Now skill floor and ceiling aren't equivalent or directly correlated to champion power, but riot doesn't want to make their game feel unsatisfying. They actively try to make the higher skill plays more powerful (again bar riotRepertoir) than the lower skill demanding plays. So it wouldn't be a perfect correlation, but it'd probably be a pretty good line of best fit between the skill range and power of champions.

I've made a post analyzing Yasuo to better address the question than I could in this comment. Follow the linked quote below to see.

>
> I&#039;m going to analyze why Yasuo has such a stigma surrounding him within League&#039;s community. I&#039;m not going to advocate for or against nerfs. This is just to discuss why certain things are or are not problems.

You literally described my friend. First he was a yasuo Main and said he is so good but didn't even know what are key blade bey blade and airblade combos now he's a gp main or idk (he changes mains every 10days or so :d) and every time he dies he says that they're scripting or hacking and rages his ass off,  smashes his table and goes afk lmao
If I ever make a misplay, I'll only have myself to blame because the only way I could possibly mess up as Yasuo is not because of the enemy comp, but by mispositioning or that I dashed the wrong way.

People hate playing against Yasuo. He is so unfun to play against that one of my friends who started playing couple of months ago deleted the game because he was sick of playing vs Yasuo and Lee in normals every single game. I know its so fun to play Yasuo, but you HAVE to understand that you are literally ruining the game for at least your lane opponent, especially if its an unexperienced player.  That is why everybody hates Yasuo and thus hates you as a person who plays him every game or to put it like this - ruins every single game they play. 
Its the same with Riven, Lee or Vayne.

My friends are calling me an a-hole for maining Yasuo. One of my friends, in his exact words, said, "I can write an essay about why playing Yasuo is bad."

Also, I feel bad about your friend there, but that's the nature of low levels. More than 50% of the time, you'll get some Yasuo or Lee main that's smurfing and Riot can't fix that, sadly. I even felt a bit bad at myself when I was smurfing my way to level 30 by spamming Yasuo.

They aren't wrong. You are a filthy yasuo player. Go play a real champ

I dont know man, either take all the hate and keep playing or switch to something more loved by the community. Even in Season 1 I loved playing Jax, I played Jax all the way to level 30 but he was broken back then and everyone hated me so I decided to start maining Orianna as I analized all the champs in the game and found her to be the most balanced and well designed. And I was right, 6 years later I am still an Ori main, she hasnt been buffed or nerfed significantly ever and I no longer have to be flamed for maining something broken. If you have better nerves than me, keep playing what you love, but never forget that the rest of us get cancer when you do :D

Welp, guess people will consider me a complete #### for playing Yasuo. : ^)
I'm also an Ezreal main btw, and Ezreal doesn't get a lot of hate. In fact, he gets a lot of love, both by the gaming and fanfic/fanart community.

Well he is a classic anime type of character without beeing too much nerdy or weeaby like Yasuo or Ahri. As far as his kit goes he is pretty annoying but extremely fair to play against, he has clear weaknesses and clear strengths, his kiting is amazing and he is extremely safe but pays for it by having the worst autoattack damage, being skillshot reliant and having trouble dealing with tanks.  On the other hand take someone like Vayne or Lucian who barely have any weakness and you can see why they suck to play against.  You should definitely try maining Ez if you are bored of Yasuo (lets be real who isnt :D)  he is also fun but much more fair and you wont get any hate, also he is well balanced so he is never trash or unplayable. GLHF
Well I do play Ez from time to time when I'm bored and I need a break from playing Yasuo. I even have a level 6 emote for him.

Because anything yasuo related that isn't an insult to the character or his playerbase gets downvoted to oblivion.

Gaming communities can get a lot on the Pitchforks&Torches side when they hate something.

> [{quoted}](name=Stars Shaper,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uNTsrvN1,comment-id=0017,timestamp=2018-03-14T12:34:00.286+0000)

> Gaming communities can get a lot on the Pitchforks&Torches side when they hate something.

Yeah actually Yasuo itself isn't the problem. The problem here is like, 90% of his playerbase. This guy just asked about the Yasuo hate, and boom downvotes. Honestly, I'd play him myself if I got some mechanical skill talent.

The "fun" fact though is that this is Yasuo haters' fault to begin with.

Most of the Toxic Yasuo players are ppl who have whined about Yasuo for months and then started to play him, failing hard because they though "windwuh muh skill!" and now they have to manage their frustration. Then there are he Yasuo carries (the ones mechanically good with with him" that got insulted and bashed to kingdom comes and now (after even getting several S which means they carried hard a enough games) have turned to be extremely tiltable because of the previous bashing they got.
yasuo is the poster child of toxicity (but not all of them are, yasuo is just the worst offender)
I think you misspelled Riven there, m8.

{{champion:157}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:67}}  Is the unholy trinity of toxicity. 

As somebody already mentioned Yasuo has a pretty overloaded kit with free crit, free dashes, 2 shields, free armor penetration, hard CC, no mana nor energy, and low cooldows, and incredibly obnoxious voice acting. Windwall in particular is a spell that is incredibly disruptive and efficient, whilst taking very little effort to use it (compare it to Fiora's parry, that you at least have to sort of time it).

Riven is similarly overloaded with lots of mobility, 2 dashes, a shield (that scales with AD ffs), a stun, and a lot of damage potential. She's gated by being mechanically intensive in that you have to animation cancel properly to actually get her to do work. That makes her player base focus too hard on micro mechanics and overlook macro/strategy/common sense, and the result is the stereotypical high skill/tiny brain Riven player that stomps lane but then chases the support spamming mastery while the enemy team is doing baron. 

Vayne is less overloaded but has a scaling %maxhealth true damage that can't be itemized against. Once she gets her items she can potentially 1v5.

All of that creates a great deal of animosity towards the champions from the get go, and a playerbase of entitled people that think carrying the game is their natural right and get extremely frustrated/tilted/toxic when they do poorly. And since they are playing such strong champions, whenever things go south it can only be the team's fault that they're not doing well. Which is why they're "gg this team" champions.

If you are vs him, he's very annoying to fight against, and whenever they kill you they tend to disrespect ( writing ez in chat, mastery spam, etc). Even if you manage to kill them or simply not to die, they probably will get fed from your teammates since people tend to ignore SS pings (low elo :c )

 If they are in your team, they either feed, blame the team and go afk, or actually perform well and get kills. From that moment, they will ignore objectives and permapush their lane without warding, challenging the other team to 1v1 and normally getting ganked by 2-3 people, giving lots of gold and throwing their advantage, just because they have to show they are REALLY GOOD at playing the game while actually having no idea apart from farming and  1v1 mechanics.

All together, whenever I see someone in my team picking Yasuo, i get scared because i can be 99% sure that he will behave like that, and he will turn the game in a 4 vs 6.

Please: Stop playing Yasuo and go try something healthier. For your own good.

You'll never get an accurate answer. People will always say "he feeds his ass off" and you'll have others going "he's op" and you'll have others going "because yasuo mains are toxic"

You want my opinion? His windwall prevents him from being kited and a lot of ADCs are jealous of his 100% crit chance. Put yasuo against any skirmisher and he'll die. {{champion:23}} shits on him. {{champion:11}} shits on him. {{champion:114}} shits on him. The only time that yasuo can really beat those 3 in a duel, especially {{champion:11}} and {{champion:114}} because {{champion:23}} will just press r and make you have to run away(assuming you're playing yasuo) is if he lands his knock up followed by a and some auto attacks.

A level 7 yasuo main.
cause they are Yasuo mains

lol no sht.
{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

Going beyond skill floors and playstyle expectations, there's also a cultural element at play.

Yasuo, to describe him as bluntly as possible, embodies the stereotypical fangirl hero. Shirtless and brooding, Yasuo's lines are very melancholy, some would say 'emo', and to some ears, positively whiny. That sort of 'never my fault anti-hero' like Illidan Stormrage (Bonus points for sharing a VA) garners a certain expectation from some players.

That happens whether they know it or not as a subconscious side-effect of the champion. It's the same reason people generally assume that Tauren female players in WoW are middle-aged and upwards women, for example.
I thought the stereotypical fangirl hero of League was Ezreal because he's basically a shounen anime protagonist and that according to the fandom, he's ship-able with any girl in League.
Different reasons, really. Ezreal's personality isn't really as 'stereotypical' as Yasuo's 'angsty ronin wanderer who can do no wrong' is.
Yasuo acknowledges that he did a lot of wrong, but he also knows that some of the things but the worst thing he ever "did" was actually done by Riven.

Ezreal's arrogant personality can be a bit stereotypical since his archetype is the, "Confident, headstrong explorer that's gifted with magic powers (his gauntlet) and potentially attracts many fangirls."
http://i.imgur.com/kIhd2hX.jpg
Well when i used to top lane i would destroy him in laning phase, but then he gets {{item:3031}} and{{item:3046}} and then win the game.

Well, that's what he does. He gets 2 items and he could kill anything in sight if he wanted to. Your job there is to delay that power spike long enough for your team to either punish him even more or end the game.
Is it fair that the game is no longer about the team and objective but about delaying that one champ because he's ridiculous?..
A lot of players are jealous that yasuo takes skill. So they try him and feed.

Free shield,ressource less , only need to pay 2 crits item to get 100% crit chance when other carries have to invest in 4 items for the same result. Low cool down tornado for hard shoving you under your tower all game . Wall immunity from projectiles. Close to no cool down gap closer, way to much wave clear, low cool down ultimate who place you out of tower range if you tower dive and free penetration on crit and since he hit 100% crit in 2 items it’s 100% pen to deny tank who try to itemize against him and conqueror just make it more frustrating. There.

its called memory bias. 

People do this with more mains than just Yasuo. You could have played with hundreds of Yasuo mains who say nothing in chat, or are nice if they say anything, BUT because you also play with Yasuo players who are asshats and talk crap all game, those are the only ones who left any kind of impression on you and so you begin to associate all Yasuo mains with your remembered experience.

Basic psychology really. And its sad.

For me its because I play supp. As a main of Thresh, Yas's kit counters me so hard if he plays right. He can make me useless easily, as well as many other champions. Its the same reason teemo was hated. His blind makes many champs unplayable into him back in his glory days. His shrooms made jungling hell, and any roams ended with multiple kills to him. A good yas can do the same and it tilts people off of the world.
I went thresh ad kid and I fought a yasuo. He fucked me up early game but when I had my full build I started to 3 shot him
The mastery 7 tilts them<3
i dont know but  almost they dont like him coz he can beat them{{champion:157}}

Because the champion is given so many handicaps that when you fail on him it's pathetic, but when you succeed on him it's unsurprising.

To be clear, i don't hate yasuo mains, I hate the champion. Though i generally hate champions on the basis that they're handed too many answers, and I dislike people who enjoy being given handouts.
Signed in just to agree with you. (first comment ever here too)
Might as well make a League TV show called, "Everybody Hates Yasuo" and all it features is Yasuo doing crazy stuff and every single champion hates or berates him, but Yasuo manages to fight back.

Il be honest, i personally love jasuo,riven, and vayne lore and the champs are well made, satisfactory to play and have a good skill cap but guess what i dont like.....disrespect.
When someone outplays me i recognize it and may even praise the person with a "wp" or "nice one"  get back up and play it a lot safer but mastery spam and the "ez" are just stupid and leave me with a sour taste in my mouth rather than leaving any respect or sportsmanship towards that player, and yay riot added emotes not meant to be "toxic" and yea they arent toxic they are fucking NUCLEAR.
And i hate to break it to you but these champions have the most toxic and disgustingly rude and disrespectful players on the rift and frankly its sad that such champs have such a shitty player base. In all my time ive meet a friendly vayne,  thats literally it just one.
Yasuo and Riven are yet to e found, and yea theres lots of toxic people out there who main other cancer champs but id say this 3 make about 70% of them alone{{champion:157}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:67}}
